retrieved_examples.nl: If f is analytic and nonconstant on a neighborhood of z0, and f(z0) â‰  0, then there exists w near z0 with |f(w)| < |f(z0)|.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Complex Metric Set

/-- Let Îµ > 0, let p(z) be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in { z âˆˆ â„‚ : |z - z0| < Îµ }, and suppose p(z0) â‰  0. Then there exists a w in { z âˆˆ â„‚ : |z - z0| < Îµ } such that |p(w)| < |p(z0)|. -/
theorem local_nonmax_analytic_nonzero {z0 : â„‚} {Îµ : â„} (hÎµ : 0 < Îµ)
  {p : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} (hp : AnalyticOn â„‚ p (Metric.ball z0 Îµ))
  (hnonconst : âˆƒ z âˆˆ Metric.ball z0 Îµ, p z â‰  p z0)
  (h0 : p z0 â‰  0) :
  âˆƒ w âˆˆ Metric.ball z0 Îµ, Complex.abs (p w) < Complex.abs (p z0) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Let Îµ > 0, let p(z) be a nonconstant complex polynomial, or more generally a nonconstant power series converging in { z âˆˆ â„‚ : |z - z0| < Îµ }, and suppose p(z0) â‰  0. Then there exists a w in { z âˆˆ â„‚ : |z - z0| < Îµ } such that |p(w)| < |p(z0)|. -/
theorem local_nonmax_analytic_nonzero {z0 : â„‚} {Îµ : â„} (hÎµ : 0 < Îµ)
  {p : â„‚ â†’ â„‚} (hp : AnalyticOn â„‚ p (Metric.ball z0 Îµ))
  (hnonconst : âˆƒ z âˆˆ Metric.ball z0 Îµ, p z â‰  p z0)
  (h0 : p z0 â‰  0) :
  âˆƒ w âˆˆ Metric.ball z0 Îµ, â€–p wâ€– < â€–p z0â€– := by sorry
